clinical_study.brief_title: Post Authorisation Safety Registry for US Patients With Generalised Lipodystrophy Treated With Metreleptin

brief_summary.textblock: Post Authorisation Safety Registry for US patients with Generalised Lipodystrophy treated with Metreleptin

detailed_description.textblock:
Post Authorisation Safety Registry for US patients with Generalised Lipodystrophy treated with Metreleptin.
This registry will add to the knowledge about metreleptin gained from clinical trials by providing information on the incidence rates of acute pancreatitis, hypoglycemia, hypersensitivity and lymphoma in patients treated with metreleptin in routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of multiple doses of Metreleptin in terms of adverse events incidence
primary_outcome.time_frame: Adverse event will be collected from first dose to last visit - up to 15 years
primary_outcome.description: Estimation of the incidence rate of several adverse events in patients treated with metreleptin as part of current clinical practice.

secondary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of the study population in terms of demographic profile, vital signs and clinical signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Demographics and Vital Signs information will be collected at all study visits - up to 15 years
secondary_outcome.description: Description of the overall demographic and clinical characteristics in all patients treated with metreleptin (pattern of use analysis)

secondary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of the study population in terms of clinical chemistry - Glycated Hemoglobin (HbA1c), Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) and Triglycerides (TG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Clinical chemistry will be collected at all study visits - up to 15 years
secondary_outcome.description: Description of routine laboratory measurements that could be inferred as efficacy endpoints (including HbA1c, FPG, and TG) over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of the study population in terms of its use of metreleptin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment information will be collected at all study visits - up to 15 years
secondary_outcome.description: Description of the metreleptin exposure information in all patients treated with metreleptin (pattern of use analysis)

arm_group.description: Generalised lipodystrophy patients treated with Metreleptin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are treated with metreleptin as part of clinical care
- Patients who provide a written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient receiving metreleptin as part of a clinical trial or through expended access including compassionate use
- Patients currently treated with an investigational agent as part of a clinical trial
